intro: Gymnosporia inermis, commonly known as the smooth gymnosporia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in dry, sandy soils. Gymnosporia inermis is adapted to arid environments and exhibits drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
